ut8EVEscQu_SE3opupBTOw.text: For how this menu is priced, you expect to be served a decent steak. Unfortunately, I cannot say that was the case here. Not only that, but the other several friends that I chatted to about eating here were also disappointed.   My recommendation: if you are looking to spend $100 a person, go to Maestros.

VRnT0WImN5m3LNxOTCRHXg.text: SO WORTH IT!!! Been here a few times now, always sat at the bar.  The steak is phenomenal! I also had the hot rock one visit.  Steak served rare and cooked on a hot rock. our rock wasn't very hot at all but i still ate the steak and loved it.  The drinks are wonderful and my favorite is the Bittered Boulevard. The must have is the duck fat fries tho and the homemade ketchup. The brussel sprouts were a little soggy and overly buttery but my guest enjoyed them, not me tho.  Overall, i enjoy the bar atmosphere and the bartenders were super attentive and fun. Being able to choose your own knife is fun too! cheers!

eYYuxDrQ1WdaHQUaHWsRzA.text: Average. For the price you can get a better meal at City Hall Grill.  Service fell short.  Food was mediocre.

iWEixavMPjEckej-XrKlrA.text: First of all the service was spot on....very attentive, helpful and efficient.  The menu is incredibly appealing,  as well as the cool and inviting decor; but for the prices, the place is way too loud and crowded.  The servers are bumping into tables trying to serve guests and guest have to squeeze by other diners to walk either to your table or to the restrooms.  This would all be acceptable if the price point was lower.....but for fine dining prices (as well as an EPIC Cristal dinner listed for 35,000..seriously) you want more comfort and peace of mind.  We were a group of 10 that sat in the private dining room and we could not hear each other while talking to each other.....even if you yelled to each other it was hard to hear.  The private dining room table was ridiculously large, so sharing side dishes was a process of sliding( really sling-shotting) the plates across the granite table top. Lastly, the portions (again for the price) were too small and skippy.  The side dishes should give you the appearance of value for price.  I think Bourbon and Bones has an identity crisis....they want to be a Maestros, City Hall, Dominicks etc but want to appeal to a hipper, downtown Scottsdale crowd.........they should either lower their prices or remove a few tables and work on their acoustics.

KRIsi_98UUzAnVWrcnB3cg.text: By far one of the worse "nice" steak houses I have eaten at. Sides were cold. Steak was dry and flavorless. I went for a drug rep dinner so I personally did not have to pay for the meal;however, if I did I would have sent the food back and walked down to Mastros.

NWk03Wq0pVTSmn95hZnBiw.text: Yes, Yes, and Yes again please kind Sir !  I walked by and thought 'hmm that looks like a cool place' whilst on the way to another destination. When I got to my original destination I found myself still thinking about "bones" and headed right back. I was not disappointed. I had the fillet and loved it. I do have a few notes to warn - I would avoid the happy hour Sauvignon Blanc - I had to give it up and go back to my regular tipple. The Second thing I wanted to add is a note to the Management - STOP HOVERING OVER YOUR STAFF. I have worked in the industry before and I can say you have a winning theme but... (1) Your checking on how things are, (2) how the drinks are going, (3) how the turnaround time is aka your micromanagement is only going to make your staff nervous and detract from your goals  I had a good time - well done, its a cool place, great atmosphere, great food, drinks, service  Go here !

xjrWAZt5erhSsfxBUsgfJA.text: This restaurant is the perfect date night spot! My fiance and I love steak, call us connoisseurs, and I was dying to try this new spot in Old Town. We both started with salads and shared their dry-aged cowboy rib eye with brussels sprouts and creamed spinach. I had the tomato and mozzarella salad and my fiance had the wedge, both were delicious. The dry aged steak was incredible and done just right. I wasn't a huge fan of the creamed spinach but the brussels were amazing! Our waiter Jeffrey was very attentive and provided great service, I had a glass of cabernet on his recommendation and it was very good. We will definitely be back!

WHaqsZbrpXsbUKsagKbWtA.text: This rating is for the bar section only. I came here to enjoy great cocktails but that wasn't the case when the bartender didn't know what Orgeat was, so instead of ordering from their menu I ordered a Stella which they were out so I settled for a Guinness which was served completely at the wrong temperature and glass. The good thing about this place was the open air bar, the great music and decor. If they can fix these small things I would come back. Here is a quick little link for the nice bartender girl who didn't know what orgeat was. Quick and simple recipes. smallhandfoods.com/recip...

2kygOCNXZnvuejYHE6ZEig.text: Oh my god. This place looks sexy on the outside, But like that hot  girl on first glance, inside was a nightmare. Slow service in a 75% empty restaurant it took over 40 minutes to get out entrees. My NY steak was inedible which they were kind enough to remove from my bill because I took one bite and almost gagged. In addition the staff who had some personality could not not deliver. My friend had the ribs and another sea bass so no complaints there. I would avoid this place unless you are going just for drinks at the bar. They won't be in business long with a deadly combination of bad service, very bad food, and high prices.

PrhcqV33g8NwUFtkF44UUQ.text: Been to B&B 3 times since it opened.  Really like the bar are with the open windows (great for people watching)...  My steak was overcooked the last time I was in, but it was still really good.   B&B needs to expand the "Bacon Service" beyond just the bar (if you've been there you know what I am talking about)...Although we requested it last time...It's good! Will go back again.

z1R2PQrfN7OewnjCa-646w.text: I wanted to celebrate my birthday at someplace new and just happened to see an ad for B&B in this month's issue of Phoenix magazine.  Scottsdale is a bit far for us to go for dinner but we saw they start serving dinner at 3:00 PM so we thought that would cut down the drive time...so off we went and are we ever glad we did.  Our dinner and dining experience was absolutely fantastic - thanks in large part to Chef J's presence at table side and his suggestions of scallops for my wife and veal chop for me.  We added hash browns and brussel sprouts, which were perfect compliments to our entrees.  My wife started with the tomato onion salad and I had the best iceberg wedge salad I've ever had with absolutely delicious blue cheese crumbles.  And for dessert, my wife had the butter cake and I had the apple crumble...both memorable and wonderful caps to one of the best meals we've ever had, anywhere.  It's quite unique to have an executive chef interact so personally with guests but a really nice touch, to be sure.  Despite the distance and drive time, we expect to be regulars at Bourbon & Bones...our new favorite restaurant!  Thank you, Chef J, for your great recommendations, super table-side manner, fabulous food and warm & friendly hospitality.  Bourbon & Bones is the kind of upscale restaurant where we want to spend our time and money.

u3llLFuWptnwp7IC_zPzeQ.text: Very modern and upscale place, the theme is suiting and it's certainly one of the nicer establishment around. Their Bacon & Eggs (pork belly, quail egg over a rosemary Johnny cake), Beet Tartare (diced beets over whipped goat cheese on fried walnut banana bread), Medjool Bleu Cheese Stuffed Dates and Devil's Cut Hot Rock Wagyu Beef are a must-have for starters! Probably my current favorite appetizers of any place at the moment. As for entree, I've had both the 10oz Filet, medium rare of course, and the Double Cut Dry Aged Pork Chop on separate occasions, and my only complaint is that the filet was not as flavorful as I expected, given the dry aging, but I would order it again either Oscar Style (Crab Claws, Bearnaise, Asparagus) or with the Bleu Cheese Granola, and the Pork Chop was a bit fatty for my liking, but otherwise tasty. Everything paired great with a Boulevardier (my drink of choice) and the nifty thing about it, is they allow you to "choose your weapon"; they have a small case full of steak knives, and you select which one you will be using, neat little idea.

photos.caption: Photo of Bourbon & Bones - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. 10oz Filet, side of Corn off the Cob and Sherried Wild Mushrooms
Photo of Bourbon & Bones - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Double Cut Dry Aged Pork Chop (bone-in, 14oz)

IhAH99sxI7PTjFfic8dKFw.text: Went here to try the amazing selection of bourbon, ended up staying all evening. Incredible meat and sides. And of course a huge selection of bourbon. I got the bison, it was spectacular.

2Hk2RL8NzNZIKjNceiMzLg.text: Their food is equivalent to the quality of Mastros but with a more welcoming atmosphere!

G9vaBcfji09Eqh17g14izA.text: Food and wine were excellent. a nice alternative to Mastro's when you want fine dining with a slightly more casual and hipster feel to it. We will definitely be back!

D3q7Dterl-j4_wrjM4junA.text: Best bar in Arizona by far. Richie Moe, Justin and Rafael are so great. They make the best cocktails, especially whiskey cocktails. The head chef is also amazing. He cooked me the best Pittsburgh veal chop ever, and the chimicurri sauce I ordered on the side was amazing.  I can't say enough about this place. Great atmosphere.

photos.caption: Photo of Bourbon & Bones - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

Tf6C1Bmv1AuurcjWpWhpbA.text: Amazing meal from start to finish...  Anything and everything you order here has so much flavor and presentation.   Wonderful collection of wines and spirits. The best lobster Mac ever and I added truffle oil... The filet Oscar .... so amazing I forgot to ask if wet or dry aged. Lol. It didn'tmatter at that point.  Dont skip on The chocolate decadence ...rich, velvety, abundant and quite possibly will feed four. The ambience is so that you could make it your own; social and loud or intimate.  Request Jimmy for your server. Very attentive, polite and friendly. Your server experience can make or break your evening. Jimmy's patience was very much appreciated.

QQeIBzCd6UP5gMbh_tz1Aw.text: Delishhhhhh all the way ! 5 star food and service !!! The aged rib eye was perfect and HUGE ! The side dishes ( truffled mash potatoes and Brussels sprouts with bacon ) were awesome !!!! My favorite was their buttercake dessert - it was better than Maestros !!!! I'm a fan !!!

TkZsMmOvrQ9qrsMsxXT0WQ.text: Amazing! The food is great, the atmosphere is fantastic. Lot more relaxed than Morton's and similar steakhouses. We enjoyed our evening thoroughly.  Brad was excellent. He recommended a new whiskey to my husband and he enjoyed it. Ask for Brad if you can... he was extremely knowledgeable and entertaining.  Kudos to a great establishment

1tb92Q5r645RFAWnvQreLQ.text: We went to B&B for a bachelorette party evening and I was thoroughly unimpressed. The layout of the restaurant wasn't fluid for our conversation, the food was extremely mediocre, a few of the girls food didn't come out as ordered and the wine wasn't great.   Our service was fabulous, which was a win but overall I feel like the concept just misses it.

FmspFrW4m22HLaUPyGZSug.text: Excellent food and service! We had a great time celebrating some birthdays at Bourbon & Bones this weekend. Every meal at the table was getting rave reviews. I had the filet (medium rare) with a side of Mac n cheese and they were both out of this world.

3ssOt8N7gT8v0Ln0Y07RJA.text: Great meal.  Steaks were awesome and all the side dishes were incredible.  You must have the Brussel Sprouts.  TOO DIE FOR.  Desert was great.

photos.caption: Photo of Bourbon & Bones - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Bourbon & Bones - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Bourbon & Bones - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

pWsGtTuxxN2CB_jvCwMUjg.text: I recently went to Bourbon & Bones for a birthday dinner and it was a five star meal in every sense! The service was phenomenal, we never once had to wait for water, a check in, etc. Our waitress Anna made excellent recommendations on their extensive (I mean extensive) bourbon and whiskey list. We were able to order a flight of bourbons we wanted to try (not on the menu but ask your server) and we tried the Manhattan, which had an amazing smoky flavor, as well as the Imperial Old Fashioned, which had just the right amount of sweetness. The bone in NY strip with the bleu cheese crust was AMAZING along with the truffled mashed potatoes. Yes. Truffled mashed potatoes. My bf had the pork chop which was outstanding as well! Oh and don't forget the bleu cheese stuffed, bacon wrapped dates we had as an appetizer. Be prepared to  spend a little more than your typical dinner, but the quality of food, drinks and service is completely worth it. Can't wait to go back!

nHYBwU94FkNKWTAEAPEvWw.text: This place is amazing service is off the hook. Steaks tender juicy cooked to perfection. Mac and cheese one of the best in town. Unbelievable whisky list and fabulous deserts.  Oh and Madoline great server.

mNo0e1ak1mqCsnNUl7K02Q.text: I am very picky about my steak and have had them all across the country. This steak was arguably the best steak I've ever had. I got a bone in ribeye medium with the blue cheese crust. It was perfectly cooked: pink all the way through the middle, crispy outside layer that had a crunch to it, and it was juicy to a point where it melted in your mouth. They also bring out a box of knives for you to choose from to cut your steak which upped the experience for me. My only regret was not getting the tomahawk ribeye, it was just a little out of my price range. I may have to go back their again tonight.

lx57wI5QMG7uAIsKmCdfEQ.text: I am from Boston, and have tried every relevant steak restaurant in town (both Smith & Wollenskies, Grill 23, Moo, Ruth's Chris, Del Frisco's, Morton's, and a few others); Bourbon & Bones served me the best bone-in ribeye I have ever had, and the filet I tried from a friend was equally phenomenal.  Service was great, as we had a loud group of friends, but Madeline kept us organized and did a great job with recommendations.  Must visit if you are looking for top quality steak in Scottsdale

FuXmHdPEXyVgI0NL08nSeA.text: I stopped in late one night for dessert on a date! I can't wait to come back for dinner one day. They have a great wine selection and obviously a lot of bourbon. Their dessert was good. We had cheesecake and creme brulee!

qNj3AHeK-l_m9cKBSdJZAg.text: Wowser! Excellent!! So good. Service 5 star everyone was top notch and super friendly. Will be here again.

TLFd8NxHn701Y1B7aGysIw.text: Wonderful restaurant.  Our waiter, Brad,  took such good care of us and the food was incredible. Everything from the melt in your mouth steak to the bacon wrapped dates were just so good. I hope to return to Phoenix and enjoy this place again!! Way to go Brad!!

f438hlahka1Lo05er7joDw.text: My new favorite restaurant in Arizona. I wish I could give them a higher rating than 5. We gad our reservation to this place which is highly recommended before you go here. Once seated drinks orders were taken quickly. They have a large selection of wines, Bourbons, scotch's and beers. So you might need some time to choose your drinks. The manager offered us a free meatball appetizer just because our table wasn't cleaned well before we were seated. This was a very good indication that they care about service and their food. I ordered the New York bone in strip steak medium rare with mashed potatoes while my wife had the petite sirloin with fries. I cannot explain enough how well the steak tasted with the right amount of fat and a near perfect sear. All in all this place is worth all the praise it gets

f0piAnxteTukxH-2jGvQLQ.text: It was good and the service was excellent. Platings could use a little refinement. I ordered the petite filet mignon Oscar style and it was very good. My husband had the pork chop and while he said it was good, it wasn't the best he ever had. The pork chop just came out on the plate by itself, no sauce, no nothing. Therefore it lost out with us not only in taste but visually as well. We had Oysters Rockefeller for an appetizer and they were good as was the French onion soup. We also shared a creme brulee for dessert and it was good. We also tried some of the bourbons. It is very pricey here and I think that is more for the service than the food.

q7mD3HGxT7mOQTf093BIjQ.text: I have only been here once, but that one time was great! The food was excellent and their whiskey selection is vast. My steak was excellent and our server was able to make great whiskey recommendations based off our menu selections, what whiskeys we have enjoyed prior, and our budget. The ambience left a bit to be desired as it seemed overcrowded and very loud (some patrons seemed like they had a bit too much whiskey) for the price point. However, I did enjoy choosing my steak knife from their unique collection.

frDKCcl92fb5Gm5hGRtNkg.text: With an advanced reservation for busy February, we were seated exactly at our scheduled time in a half booth, half chair table for 4.  After we ordered drinks, we were kindly asked by the manager if we didn't mind switching to half-circle booth overlooking our old table in exchange for their covering our first round of drinks...well, sure I suppose!  The new booth had basically a bright spotlight on my seat (weird...maybe they need to change out the bulb or redirect it since it was uncomfortable to be seated there...but hey, a free drink?).  Anyways, no one ever ended up sitting at the table we got bumped from..weird.  Regarding service, we never had to wait for drinks or water refills.  The bread basket was lovely (we liked it all EXCEPT the pretzel breads) and refilled upon request.  Entrees  I had the crab cakes as entree - decent but not spectacular. I finished but my bf only took a single bite and kept to his steak My bf had the filet since that's what I will take a few bites of, and we both enjoyed it - not a bite was left The other diner had the bison steak (recommended by the server as "I mean, where else can you get a bison steak?") and it was finished and reportedly good  We also got a dessert (gratis I believe) but it was so unremarkable I don't even remember.  Service was fine.  The only weird thing besides the musical tables we experienced was their "choose a knife" gimmick.  I asked incredulously, so...what knife should I get for crab cakes and the response was "um I don't know".  LOL, ok well neither do I, buddy!

m8Q6yOAUMyvWrS52TuBM5g.text: Went here with a total of 6 people. It's a pricey spot.   Wait staff was very friendly, and tended to our needs as a group very well.   Appetizers that we had was the beef carpaccio, wagyu beef, and fried calamari. All excellent. Calamari was tender, not rubbery. The wagyu came with a hot rock for cooking. Presentation for all was good.  For dinner I ordered the Colorado lamb. Large lamb chops which was surprising. Others ordered ribeye and I believe NY strip. These cuts looked amazing.    This is a solid spot to try. Could be a little less pricey. I've been in restaurants of same food presentation and quality and spent less as a group.

9T6VE2EYzZ9YJ_OvM4bDfw.text: Nice place! Very classy and the service was great! We went for happy hour and everything was tasty! Awesome selection of wine and of course bourbon. I especially liked the hot stone steak which you cooked yourself at the table (somewhat like Korean bqq meets shabu shabu, but fancier), so that was fun! I also had meatballs which were yummy. This is not your basic eatery, and I'm thrilled to have something that isn't just a pricey old town restaurant with a cool vibe; they actually have really good food! P.S. I'm a huge fan of sitting in the bar to enjoy a more lively atmosphere and we sat in the bar area, but at a surrounding table. The chairs were divine. Like super comfortable bar chairs. Weird I know, but I thought I'd mention it bc I actually took time to admire the chairs.

OTgLUHp_E8kXeZkKufXOEw.text: This restaurant was recommended by a hotel my family stayed at in the area. After a graduation we had a late dinner and were greeted by the hostesses and sat promptly. Our waiter Brad made sure our evening was special in every possible way. Brad took the time to answer any questions and made recommendations. From the appetizers to the dessert our service was amazing. The steaks, seafood, and sides were prepared perfectly and all tasted amazing. This restaurant definitely deserves 5 stars. Thank you Bourbon & Bones and our waiter Brad for making my day so special!

B_lxKmIF-WlVOttiT8-ejA.text: I'll preface this review with a disclaimer: we came in with a rowdy, rowdy bunch. We were on a bachelorette weekend and had NO reservation. I kindly asked the maitre d' if there was anyway he could make something happen and low and behold, a table to seat all 5 of us was made available. We had a very knowledgeable and entertaining waitress, who treated us like gold. Everything was prepared properly, arrived promptly, and tasted amazing. The ambiance is upscale, but not snobby or unaccommodating in anyway. I would definitely return.

photos.caption: Photo of Bourbon & Bones - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Dirty Martini--done right!!
Photo of Bourbon & Bones - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Petite Filet, accompanied with shareable sides of Max and cheese, truffle mash, and Brussels sprouts
Photo of Bourbon & Bones - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. House salad--delish!

2kwUzx-7LQegs9pDRXYqpA.text: The best hideaway for a impressive dinner date.  Location location location.  Perfect for dinner before was night out in the town.

photos.caption: Photo of Bourbon & Bones - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

A3COVr7ZuyLZP_C-qWnOVg.text: GREAT HAPPY HOUR!   Came here with some friends after work and shared a few happy hour dishes and were so happy with all!!   Calamari (crispy and great aioli), Cheese Plate (very good, they just need to provide more crackers), Steak and Fries, & the coolest Hot Rock Wagu Beef.  The meat had amazing flavor in the steak and fries.  The Hot Rock Wagu meat is unreal! Then when you dunk it in butter and top with the salt they give its divine.  I will even say the teriyaki sauce they bring with it as well was very good, and I am not a big sauce on my meat kinda girl... Happy hour wines are delicious and nice pours! Our server was great and very nice!

bVtNvfRgdDZW8_-rLBcYoA.text: Great steak house. Amazing selection of bourbon from around the world. Food was perfect! Atmosphere was great! Staff was helpful. Would highly recommend.

photos.caption: Photo of Bourbon & Bones - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Ceaser salad and hot rock steak app.

hAnSIAyOQI-Rzosnw7ruqA.text: This was one of my worst experiences in old town!!! Michelle is an awful server!!!   I live so close so I figured I would try it out. I let the host know that it was my first time and my friend and I would only be having a drink. With no problem she sat us in the bar area right away.  Immediately we felt uncomfortable, because the server snatched the menus out of our hands when we let her know we were only having drinks. She was very rude and disrespectful. I watched her walk over to another staff member and he stared at our table until we left. If "drinks only" were going to be an issue, the host should have communicated that to us before seating us. I will NOT be recommending this place for its unwelcoming environment. I felt like we were being discriminated.

-gObWw5AnfI9bJyrp12YtQ.text: Had an amazing experience at Bourbon and Bones last night.  The in house Sommelier, Chris, was masterful in his wine pairings. The by the glass list is the best I've ever seen. The 32oz bone in Ribeye was cooked perfectly and paired with the Shafer Cabernet that Chris picked out...perfection. Huge thanks to the entire staff. If u haven't been here u need to check it out ASAP.

APS_OUwCBkRx7NYc13m8Yg.text: I am in town and friends took me to dinner. They'd never been and thought we could all try somewhere new. Being the foodie that I am, I was totally game.  Pros: Nice ambience and good location. Good service with smiles. My martini was good and do was my house salad.  Cons: My steak did nothing for me. I ordered the petite filet and the first time it came out burnt and well done. They tried again and this time, it was medium well but still burnt in several places. This steak wasn't nearly as flavorful as I thought it would be. It can't be as aged as they say. Since it's a steakhouse, I was sorely disappointed.  The best part was spending time with my friends.

a3yEN3Eh0sKytfBiaeJMPw.text: Ordered a Woodfords and prime rib. The Woodfords was great, the prime rib mediocre, horseradish sauce bland and au jus flavorless. The food came five minutes after the drinks, so no relaxing before the meal. Twice baked potato with meal was cold and bland also The corn served with it was actually good. Service was pleasant.

HAvEkhbegKSjcM39EizDEw.text: Service wasn't equivalent to the price point. Food was good, but this place, in my opinion was over priced. Could have just been Scottsdale. Enough said.

Gy-rQzZGeUl-AxBUpGODbg.text: The food here is excellent as is the service. We sat at the high tops in the bar area which is excellent for people watching. There is also a traditional restaurant area. It is very loud and pricey (but remember you are in Scottsdale) but the quality and portions are excellent. The drinks are substantial. We each ordered an appetizer. In addition, one ordered asparagus which was delicious and perfectly prepared and the other ordered a loaded baked potato which was also delicious and was bigger than a child's Nerf football. That was more than enough to satisfy our appetites. A great place to have an upscale dinner

6QzT3jgtLl6f84ril8BnQQ.text: I liked the darker, intimate ambiance of B&B. It appeals to those on a date night or a casual group of diners. Nothing over the top "fancy". The service was great and the food was too. Our group enjoyed: - Tomahawk - Pork Chop - i prefer mine charred, yet medium (Carson's serves it this way!) it was slightly tough to cut into on the outside, but the interior was a True medium. The red wine glaze was a great accompaniment suggested by our server. - The Stuffed Medjool Dates - as described - The Meatballs - The Tuna Tartare - very tasty and beautiful presentation, loved the sesame sticky rice - Lobster Truffle Mac & Cheese - great! the perfect subtle essence of Truffle (nothing overpowering and a great complement to the seafood) - Brussels Sprouts - a dessert veg, for sure (bacon/maple/bourbon) - Loaded baked potato - as expected  Be sure to arrive earlier than your reso's to enjoy an ($18, ehemm) B&B Manhattan at the bar and some house-bacon in the Mason jar - a nice touch to start the evening off.

Uw0wOln0id8XixAxqEa5SQ.text: As someone that is French trained and born and raised in Texas. I've worked at plenty of steak houses. Currently living in Vegas and working for a celebrity chef. This was extremely disappointing. The service was just ok. Was extremely excited about the meatballs. Who knew that meatballs are suppose to be charred on the outside and cold and uncooked in the middle. Took 10 mins to flag anyone down finally the som came by we were suppose to get another one. Never came! Steak came looked like something from the microwave. Still under cooked ordered medium rare. Sad the fact the meatballs had more char to it. For a steak house it needed to be more charred then that. Brussel sprouts were ok granted it was suppose to be the best thing on the menu. The bacon was not crispy at all. Loaded baked potato??? Ehh you can get a better one from Wendy's. Over all for spending 150 it was just ok.

TJSVcngWOcC5i05MhV-Aew.text: Our first experience was average. GM Daniel invited us back to give them a try. Same waitress this time. Same mangers. Service was on point. Very attentive. Steaks cooked perfectly! Wines were of course great. Such a comprehensive wine menu. They even had my husbands favorite bourbon! Win! Our sever recommended an apple crumb like dessert with ice cream. It's was fantastic. And of course from the time we pulled up until the time we left our valet Jessie was perfect! Thank you for inviting us to try you again. We will be back.

JxuC0oWVH31BIhAfvA44eQ.text: I've dined in here a few times and always had a great experience. We tend to order a few apps or a couple entrees to share. My favorite app is The Hot Rock. It's a must try!

JG7wPLK7l3dW9Vn2YcAD8A.text: It's been a while, but this review is very much deserved.  Let's get started, staff and service was good, food was awful.  Complimentary bacon, fantastic, best food on the menu that's not on the menu! +$0  Octopus, presentation was a bunch of undercooked calamari pieces in a white bowl with onions that look the same, chewy, salty. -$22  Cauliflower, decent. It was a side, $8 yay for health.  Bourbon Pecan Buttercake, presentation, shit on a plate, the ice cream on top was fantastic. Pieces of pecan would've look better if individually placed one by one on the ice cream. $10.  Glass of Prisoner wine, $27. Very expensive glass but it was good!! Friendly female bartender offered another glass but I wanted to keep my thoughts to my self.   Last but not least, mixed, unorganized order but yeah stay along..  WAGYU New York Strip, - - - - - negative negative -$49 for 8 oz. okay seemed a little too good to be True, maybe I misunderstood what WAGYU is but I've never had bad WAGYU, this was a bad steak and worst WAGYU, I should've asked for the meats paperwork, it's name, origin and everything I felt like I got scammed! Can they legally call a steak wagyu if it's not wagyu, idfk but god awful.   Anyways this isn't directed towards the staff because it ain't your fault sweet child of mine. Maybe Chef, maybe chef received bad quality produce. Who knows.   I came here two years ago, thought it was trash, reconfirmed it's trash.  Please don't place a hit on me due to an honest review!

photos.caption: Photo of Bourbon & Bones - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Bourbon & Bones - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Bourbon & Bones - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

-rvaVBDnd1R9PbEaPX7Yrg.text: I've had the halibut, scallops, prime rib, wagyu beef hot rock, calamari, and everything on the happy hour menu. It is a bit pricey but the food is good. The atmosphere and ambiance is sleek and trendy. This is one of my favorite happy hour spots in old town. I know bourbon is their thing, I'm just not a bourbon drinker. However I can attest that Richy and Lauren make an excellent vodka martini - and who doesn't like free bar bacon served in a mason jar!

photos.caption: Photo of Bourbon & Bones - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

BrQd96jCAxFy0bDhSUfk7w.text: Great Steak! Great Whiskey! Great Service!  I came to Scottsdale for a business trip and decided to give Bourbon & Bones a try. I had Tina as a server and she was absolutely fantastic! She gave me recommendations that were very much needed and made my experience a great one. I'm glad I listened to her on her recommendations. The steak here is so far the best I've had. Juicy and amazingly delicious . Mac and Cheese was also extremely good. I would highly recommend the Devil Cut Lava Rock appetizer. Their Old Fashion was really good too, They have over 400+ whiskey selections so unless you know exactly what you want, Tina can give you some really good recommendations. Ask for Tina and she could make sure you have a good experience with the restaurant!

ybTQxhTZsKYXSK3t6eKh_w.text: Fantastic experience. Bourbon and whiskey for days.   Waiter was excellent. Food was excellent (prime rib and twice baked potato). Dessert was amazing (cinnamon ice cream on monkey break with bananas foster).   Music is upbeat and modern, which is refreshing compared to typical steakhouses.   Fellow diner with dairy allergy was treated like royalty.

UKf3WVU7ovZS1fGi9hML2w.text: Excellent service and ambiance.  Delicious food!! Could not get over how everyone is so attentive.  Definitely recommend and plan to return for the amazing Filet Mignon.

JaQ7U7dixBHfsrs9ldW9jg.text: Not quite sure how this place has 4 stars.  Came here on the advice of a server at Talking Stick, I won't get her in trouble by naming her but she knows who she is.   I was starving, first meal of the day. So we jumped right in to a couple of appetizers: Cheese board and hot rock wagyu beef. They were on happy hour, but you wouldn't tell. Both were delicious! And there was so much food we had to wait 2 hours to order our actual dinner.   I had the bone-in ribeye. Cousin had the 10oz filet. Both were amazing. I ordered mine medium rare with a little extra char outside. It was the most perfectly cooked steak I've ever had.   The attention to detail with the food and cocktails is incredible. Raphael, Ryan, and the bar staff were super friendly and on top of it 100%. I have absolutely nothing to complain about at all other than I forgot to photo my steak! From LA but we'll be back!  It sucks that there's a lot of "alleged" 4 star places around here that kinda drown out this obvious 5 star establishment. Keep up the great work.

photos.caption: Photo of Bourbon & Bones - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

UlLBtRj3OJnpCAFGEBHWBQ.text: We made a reservation for dinner earlier this week with some friends to celebrate the holidays and Bourbon & Bones did not disappoint!  The atmosphere is lively, the decor is sleek and modern, the service is fantastic (young, but extremely professional) and the food was top notch!    I enjoyed a petite filet mignon medium rare plus and it was cooked to perfection.  Our group of 4 enjoyed the corn, mashed potatoes, asparagus, creamed spinach, and brussels sprouts sides - all of them were so flavorful and delicious.  For dessert, we shared the warm apple crumble and the bourbon pecan butter cake...amazing as well.    Bourbon & Bones is a great addition to the Old Town Scottsdale dining scene!

5aQNOiBH61dMdzpVBvq3nA.text: Tried Bourbon & Bones this evening because my mother wanted steak. Menu is typical of a steakhouse as were the prices, we had bone in filet and sauteed scallops. Both were tasty. Steak was booked perfectly. Good marbling. Mashed potatoes were very potato forward and not over seasoned. Scallops were a little salty. Sauce of kale and mushrooms was delicious but somewhat thick, so it took me a minute to notice it. Cauliflower and golden raisins were done before so not excited about these. Overall food was tasty. Service was excellent. Did not have drinks because I was driving. I would come here again.

photos.caption: Photo of Bourbon & Bones - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Sautéed scallops, kale mushroom purée, golden raisins and roasted cauliflower
Photo of Bourbon & Bones - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Bone it filet with mashed potato

qjm_ywcY39W-nz7ZQO6gkQ.text: No  Had two drinks and three apps and that was enough...and we didn't finish anything, we couldn't...too awful.   I had a Fizzing Flower...prosecco was flat. Fail.  He had a whiskey sour, $18 dollar fail.   We tried: Grey tartare with an already broken yolk. Ew.  Octopus and squid, the octopus was the only passable item.  Oysters...can't mess those up, right? Unless they happened to incorrectly shucked...don't worry, they were.   The manager called me after and offered to do a redo of our meal. I couldn't. Even for free...I'd pass.   Bourbon and Bones, Crab and Mermaid and Cold Beers and Cheeseburgers...all terrible...all in a row. Just stay away.

TWMVm2095CYhnWF0QkcyFg.text: This restaurant is absolutely fabulous. The quality of food and service is worth the price. We had the back room for 12 which was a perfect evening.   Frank the manager went out of his way to make it a great evening. Jack the waiter and his team were there when needed but not hovering or invading our night. The truffle mashed potatoes, macaroni and cheeses, rib eye and lamb were outstanding. We tried so many things that I can't list them all but everything was flavorful and top quality.

716RclD2cE8Yd6UV6gHeBQ.text: I don't see how this concept is going to succeed.   It's priced like a high end steakhouse but without the attributes of a high end dining experience.  The service was fine. The atmosphere is okay....going for that trendy, sparse look.  The tables are a little close; servers and customers are constantly trying to squeeze through spaces that barely exist. The noise volume is pretty high.  That, however, is the least of their worries.  The food just doesn't deliver for this price point.  The starters and salads were nice but the steaks simply had no flavor....decent cuts, cooked okay but there is nothing there flavor wise.  The sides are also nothing to write home about either.   Everything seemed to lack taste.  We had a good time but if I'm going to spend over $250 for my wife and I to go to dinner I want "Amazing", not average.  And if I'm entertaining clients I have to have a 'Wow' factor; unfortunately, there is no 'Wow' here.  (And, yes, the steak knife presentation is a cool touch but that shouldn't be the most interesting part of a meal.)  I'm glad we gave it a try but this is a one time only visit for us.

xVe7CM16xUmgC1dN2Guljw.text: Went here with my parents and boyfriend for dinner. It has a great atmosphere, excellent selection, and the food was very good. I would definitely recommend this place for a nice dinner out.

Wj0DX-xBBkH4ucE1pLisYw.text: Food was very good but the whole place was just phenomenally overpriced. If you want a steak - which doesn't include anything other than the meat - once you're done with sides you should expect to pay $60-$100 per person without any drinks or appetizers. I've eaten far better steaks for considerably more reasonable prices...

I94r0kVz9n4DH_UrqGIEKQ.text: Excellent service. Top shelf steak. Great birthday dinner. The key lime cheesecake was fantastic. Kudos. As good as if not better that those "chains".

6UZggvrFcRh5gvrJGng4ow.text: First time in to Bourbon & Bones and the space is really cool. I'm kind of a snob about restaurant bathrooms and felt like they were underwhelming (Only downside)  Otherwise everything was really good. Prices are what you'd expect for a Scottsdale Steakhouse so with any alcohol be prepared to drop a couple hundred dollars for dinner for two.   Steak was cooked to perfection. Fiancee has a 24oz T Bone and the flavor got better and better as you worked into the middle of the cut. Lobster mac and cheese was good but I think it was a little overpriced for what you get. Oysters were perfectly shucked. Special of the night was a braised short rib and the flavor and glaz on that were 100% amazing.   Our server was Bobby and he was awesome. I personally enjoy the service aspect of eating out as much as the food/ambience and he really delivered good service. Friendly, trendy, attentive but not over the top or in your face. He had superb product knowledge and you can tell that he is a True professional.   Overall 5 stars. Would take clients/friends here if they were in town.

JeATRHj2HT7GGfl_cxGl-Q.text: My dining experience here was incredible.  We had 8:30 PM reservations on a Friday night. We grabbed a drink at the bar and were seated at 8:40 PM which was fine because I did ask for time to grab a glass of wine! Our server was attentive and not over bearing.    Jumbo shrimp cocktail was good, however, it does contain a lot of horseradish. So if you don't like that then stay away from this particular appetizer!   We split the bone-in rib-eye for $49 and it was amazing! Please note- the only reason why we split the steak was because I don't eat much.  This steak was flavorful and we still didn't finish it between the two of us!   We got sweet corn and mushrooms on the side, didn't finish all of them either, but I was very pleased with both dishes. Would order them both again.   We split everything and we did not leave hungry. Definitely will be back!

gg7-NknhC08ajjiSjCPRBg.text: In fairness to the review we sat at the bar and only ordered after dinner drinks.  We had ate somewhere else and were walking the strip and this place looked too cool to pass up.   The drinks were fantastic and carefully and skillfully crafted at the bar.  The bar is gorgeous and has the largest selection of liquor I have seen of different whiskeys, rues, bourbons, etc. the ambience is gorgeous and it is an open air environment with beautiful lighting. they give you complimentary Bacon at the bar We watched as others around us were delivered their meals and dish after dish looked so delicious and beautifully plated.   In a great location and a fun inviting atmosphere.  Don't pass this one up!

dj7_pDxwk7WA6KzAFmBPcw.text: I was super hesitant to go to this place after reading some of the reviews here, but I am glad i did. We had 9 people in our party and this was one of the few times that a big party's order didn't get messed up and that food was actually on time.  Their service is excellent. Food and sides were delicious. They keep checking on us and refilling out waters. I am a big steak fan and I definitely recommend this place. I tried the bone filet mignon and they cooked it flawlessly. Everyone loved their food and service. If you are Looking for a delicious steak at a fair price, give this place a try.

ytfrfdXz8IUSOEMZV3Z8pA.text: Filet mignon was ok, not more not less. Had hoped for more of a 'wow this Arizona meat!' experience.  Service was very professional, prompt and friendly. Brussels sprout for side very tasty.   What brings this down to 3 stars or even less for me is the noise level - too loud to have a decent conversation. At a place were I quickly pay close to $100 per person,  I find it ridiculous having to yell all the time and ask my partner 'sorry can you repeat that?'. It's not a pub or bar after all.

pIPGAwuW4464bL8W5KEILA.text: Stumbled upon this place late last night  They kept the kitchen open for us   The wine list and bourbon list was excellent  The staff and management where completely knowledgeable ! They couldn't do enough for us !  Everything we had was great  The dates  The stone beef  The salads   This place is a hidden gem!   Will return !

B-ZK3tUEg4W12Pc2A3y1vA.text: Tall, older bartender was unbelievably rude, as well as the manager. Treated us terribly, so pretentious, acted like this was the greatest restaurant and customers should be privileged to dine here. *all the other bartenders and staff were super nice though*

2C7fnSTtrji3CQZxEcMo1A.text: Didn't try the food but drink was delicious and the service was great. Nice ambiance as well. The manager was nice and cleaned up a seat for us so we can bring our baby to ring his first NYE

ZEx1sxiJ2o8A0A-Z6IEi-A.text: $32 for a Jack & Coke (least expensive whiskey I could find) and a beer is just too rich for my blood. The atmosphere isn't cool enough or the people that wonderful to command that kind of money. Not for me.

photos.caption: Photo of Bourbon & Bones - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Epic Cristal Dinner

86jcCAevROzyNEDSu2vQog.text: For almost $140 a person I expect a lot more.     We had a group of 12 to celebrate a birthday.   Our server was pleasant and attentive.  It was weird that we had to ask for bread while we waited though....and from the GM who just happened to be walking by.  The Grilled Squid and Octopus appetizer was very good.  The Ceaser had a beautiful presentation and was delicious.   The steaks however were just okay.  I love bone in filet and order it anytime I can find it.  The steak's temperature was done exactly as requested; the meat was tender.   There was absolutely no flavor....which for $49 there should be some sort of flavor.  My husband had the Ribeye; it was good but not great....again lacked flavor.  And the brussel sprouts were inedible due to their lack of seasoning; they were just bitter.   None of the other sides looked very inspiring either.  I didn't try the dessert but I heard it was very good.  I won't be back.  I love a decadent experience and I don't feel you can get that at Bones and Bourbon.  And for their prices it should be decadent, not 'just okay.'

sp1QdD3bbiI6kvMRytc7Pw.text: I was extremely excited to try this steak house. I went for my birthday this weekend, so needless to say my expectations were high.   Here's my initial interpretation; if you want to compete with Ruth's Chris, Steak 44; and Oceanclub, then you better tighten up the screws. Especially given what you are charging.   Service was nice. Our waiter was helpful, and attentive.   My $50 filet was extremely over cooked. So much that the manager came over and was shocked by the discrepancy: I asked for medium rare, and the inside was almost brown. To their credit, they were super nice about making me a new one, which turned out great. However, when the final bill came I was charged for 3 steaks...which they corrected.  After dinner they began setting up my table for dessert since it was my birthday. They made us a delicious peach pound cake. However, when the final bill came they charged me for my birthday dessert. Here's the thing; if I'm paying for my dessert I should get to see the dessert menu!!! If you are picking for me then the implication is you are paying for it. The waiter even said "we got something for you". At this point I was too tired to fight it, so I let it slide and paid for it.   Also, we ordered coffee with baileys. When it came we got 2 cups of coffee, and 2 glasses of baileys.... I wanted bailey in my coffee as it is usually prepared.   Conclusion. The little things mentioned above don't happen at the other steak houses. Which is why people feel comfortable spending that type of money.  Don't charge people for birthday desserts, don't over cook a $50 filet, don't screw up the receipt, and don't make people mix their own coffee/alcohol beverage.

jLf9UVNBETt4Dr4DLD-5Gw.text: This place is exactly what Old Town needed. This place has it all from wet aged to dry aged meats. I have had both the Bone in Ribeye and the Dry Aged pork chop and they are out of this world!  The cocktails and wine list will compete with any ones in the Valley. Their Bourbon & Whiskey list is unprecedented with almost 200 selections.   The atmosphere is very energetic and upbeat. The decor is what separates this from any traditional steak house in the valley. The take reservations which is great, because on the weekends this place is packed.   As for Desserts go with the Butter Cake! They add peaches, toasted pecans and an bourbon glaze...do I need to say anything else!

0ATMX_PRpBdcZtqB97ZOSA.text: First time won't be the last. Exceptional food, drinks and ambiance surpassed by the service. A new fav!

photos.caption: Photo of Bourbon & Bones - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

pCWdmp5DEKYu51Sb9NOd4g.text: Excellent food but service and cocktails are not the best. We've been here multiple times, and the last time we went we all ordered the same cocktail to start off. We enjoy craft cocktails and had high hopes. When it came we all unanimously agreed that it sucked. They called it a whiskey sour, but it tasted nothing like one. It was very flat, and had almost no flavor to it at all. We told the waitress we didn't care for it, and her response was dismissive. We sent one back, nearly full, and asked for an old fashioned to replace it. She still charged us for the one we sent back, and then charged $40 for the old fashioned, which is not the price on the menu, so she gouged us. Bad attitude, bad service and bad cocktail. They have great food though. Delicious.

z9Xdv-ASHD3MMUUswDosvQ.text: Disappointed in food and service at Bourbon & Bones. It's noisy and expensive -- not worth the price for a Saturday evening outing with friends (four couples total), when there are so many excellent restaurants in Scottsdale. Some things that stuck with us the next morning:  * Ordering a nice bourbon -- Angel's Envy -- resulted in this comment by the waiter: "That's a starter bourbon. You should have this instead," he said, pointing to one costing nearly twice as much. Uh, no. (The Angel's Envy is listed as $16 on the menu, but came through as $19 on the bill.)  * We only knew that appetizers had been ordered when servings of Hot Rock Wagyu Beef arrived for half the table. Sitting on the other side of the table, we were never asked about appetizers -- which is a shame, because we had planned to try the Chop House Meatballs.   * My order of "OVEN ROASTED 1/2 RED BIRD CHICKEN" was more like the size of three Chicken McNuggets. Not even close to a half chicken. It was tasty, but frankly, I've had half-chicken dinners at Boston Market that were bigger and tastier.  * My wife's order of the 14oz veal chop was fatty and largely inedible. She mentioned this was the worst veal chop dinner she'd ever had. The waiter never came back to ask how things were -- at least not to our side of the table. He spent about 95% of his time chatting with the other side of the table.  * My bourbon was gone before the dinner came; I was never offered another beverage. But then again, the waiter wasn't interested in our side of the table, he was too busy laughing and pouring wine for the other side.  * This event celebrated one of our party's birthday. We didn't feel celebratory when it turned out that the house's surprise birthday dessert (I think it was a warm apple crumble) ended up on the bill! It was removed when we complained.  * On the positive side: the baked potato was excellent, as was the sauteed corn. My "starter" bourbon was tasty and satisfying. The wine ordered by one of the couples was not too marked-up: $42 for the bottle, compared to a retail of $20. One of our party was drinking soft drinks, and the waiter kept him "filled." And they do a neat thing where they present each diner with a big box of different steak knives, and you get to choose your weapon -- we all enjoyed that.  Our dinner bill was $131. It was overpriced for what we were served, and how it was served.

jZcqQV_Y1AMaVjiRxVtWXQ.text: We had family vacation in Scottsdale and found this gem in Old Town.  We sat in the bar area where the windows were open and the weather was perfect.  Our waitress (can't remember her name but she is a Russian woman) was amazing! Prompt, knowledgeable and friendly.  The steaks were on point.  Would definitely go back if we visit Scottsdale again.

R6Dtq7zRxI-w4CBVIo2oLw.text: I love whiskey, I love steak and work with bones for a living so I thought this place was the place for me. I was wrong.   My 6oz steak was more like 3-4 and over cooked. It was as thin as my hand.  Gave us bottled water when it wasn't requested. They took it away and still charged for it Asparagus was served floating in oil The 15 dollar martini I ordered was mainly mixer. I asked for kernel or GG. It was obviously not and when I asked they were upset that I would question their mixology.   Very loud need to almost yell at your company sitting across from you. People are either dressed for a high end steakhouse or short shorts and flip flops.   $200 that would've been better spent somewhere else.

pIeHhdVstp3UeFQQ-rmKUw.text: Awful. Had guests from Ca in town and took them here. I was embarrassed.  When one of my friends steak wasn't cooked mid rare as requested and the server was informed, the manager on duty came over and rudely shined a flashlight on the food to "verify" and question him. How completely unprofessional which in turn made my friend just tell the guy in the suit never-mind just to avoid a further production.   Needless to say, we won't be going back here again!!

piycE9sV78owGvXxHUQyTg.text: We heard great things about this place but my husband and I were not impressed. My husband is a big bourban lover and the bourban was triple the price of other restaurants. Then there is the food, it's not bad but nothing was worth the price on the menu. The waitress was not very nice and the service was not very good. Overall a bad experience.

16n_is2BgKoTQqnyjrhEpg.text: To sum it up....this place was good, not great.  Our server was good and they gain a lot of points, because they always kept my water cup filled.  The steak was good, but nothing that memorable.  I've had better at other places.  Their mac n cheese was my favorite part of the dinner.....that was tasty.   I don't feel that the quality matches the cost.  I'm all about paying a little more for great food, but I don't feel the food here was.  I'm glad I tried it out, it wasn't that I disliked it, but there are so many other places to dine at that I most likely won't be back.

pOQSUuyGAIM0Q0cdVnjN8A.text: B&B was simply perfect!  We came in with a large party and were well taken care of. Great food, great atmosphere and management that honestly cared about the restaurant!  Highly recommended

tEkoMtbE_VwXLjSdOwhJ6w.text: I first came here after looking for a place to get a good steak in Scottsdale for a friends birthday. I have since come in a few times when I'm in town for various reasons. I have yet to be disappointed by the service or food. We usually order a few appetizers to share, steaks and a few drinks, switching things up each time to try something new. The appetizers are always creative and tasty. The steaks are always cooked on point. I'm pretty easy going when it comes to drinks but I do like to try different things and haven't been let down there either.  The service is always great, whether we are at the bar or a table. You gotta love being able to select your knife to use during dinner.  Yes, it is a bit pricey. No, its not your normal snooty, over priced restaurant. People talk, and enjoy themselves here. I guess if you're trying to have a good time, this is your place. If you want to eat in silence, while staring at your plate... Try some ear plugs... because its still worth it.

X7YcQIaQcPW5QnbA5AUX8Q.text: This place is so terrible I don't even know where to begin. Let's start at Bourbon... I'm from Kentucky, so I know my bourbon better than the average person, their selection is very weak and very overpriced, especially compared to other high end restaurants in the area. On top of that, if you want it severed on the rocks you have 2 options. Options #1 - Pay $5 for one large ice cube, yes that is correct $5 for frozen water. Option #2 - a cup full of crushed ice, full to the brim smh! The food is very subpar, for the price save yourself time and money and go to City Hall and have an actual good high end steak and high end bourbon. Service was crappy too, our server didn't know much.   Tourist stay away, this place is a terrible representation of what our great old town neighborhood has to offer.  Very excited to see what goes in next after this place goes out of business! Hope it's soon :)

nfGeZf7duH4RvL7TXNa0yQ.text: Had a dinner here again and highly recommend. This time brought spouses. Waiter (Jeff) and assistants do an excellent job of looking after your needs. Beef Carpaccio was excellent and the Bone in tenderloin was cooked to perfection with great flair we. All enjoyed and the 2013 Faust Cabernet was perfect from a good wine list and whiskey selection (love the frozen round ice cube).

photos.caption: Photo of Bourbon & Bones - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Nice open place

_M2p-NI-G-B4wx4jnMCSLA.text: This meal was excellent,  top to bottom.  The prices are high, but service and quality were so impressive that I never questioned the value of what we received.   This would be a place to bring loved ones, clients you'd like to impress, or anyone who really deserves something special.   If you have children who are mature and well behaved, maybe bring them, but probably you'll prefer to get a babysitter and enjoy this experience thoroughly free from parental distractions.

photos.caption: Photo of Bourbon & Bones - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

O_PUMb0EFjEk3EpQdrn9JQ.text: If you drink enough of the cocktails, you might enjoy the food more than I did. Had the Bison New York strip which was under-seasoned and overcooked. Had a party of 6 for a business dinner and was there early, but the food was very disappointing.   Order a Sazerac, it's not the best in the valley, but it comes with a fun show. The bourbon selection is great, and the wait staff was very attentive. Wish the food was better, perhaps the business threw off my enjoyment.

L1kcGDZwPjR5jW6GkQK4xw.text: some of the best scallops i have ever had!  very vibrant bar & restaurant with impeccable service - even at the bar!  Definitely a must!

lbJeu8x836BnUkHWzgtR6w.text: I'm honestly shocked that this place has received so many bad reviews. I can't speak to other peoples' experiences here, but ours was Perfection.   I'm from the midwest, grew up in Nebraska & Iowa. They basically raise you on steak dinners there. And my filet mignon from Bourbon & Bones was - hands down - the single best steak I have ever had in my life. It can't get better than this. Perfectly cooked at medium rare +. The side dishes were great. My fiance is a vegetarian and they made a special meal just for her, that was also amazing.   Everything from our Old Fashioneds to the excellent wait service, I will definitely go back here.

YzT4YnxX2tUr0k4ICMa0rA.text: A fabulous night filled with great wine, cocktails, food, and let's not forget the Butter Cake!  Thanks to Jessica and team for the wonderful service - you rock!

photos.caption: Photo of Bourbon & Bones - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Awesome cocktails and Butter Cake!
Photo of Bourbon & Bones - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

R29wJOHaBXGzCJxUac7diA.text: This place is overpriced for what it offers . Menu is very limited . The food is good , but I've had better steak at The Keg . The location is good, and the atmosphere is pretty nice , but that's not enough to justify the price. Over all, just mediocre . I was not impressed with anything .

MPb5H6lo50TNSXF0LULEPQ.text: We came here for my husband's birthday dinner and left fat and happy. Emphasis on "fat."  We didn't have a reservation, but I figured since we were early-ish (about 6:20 on a Saturday) that we could give it a shot. We had no problem snagging a small booth by the window. The space is sleek and modern, and our server was very nice.  We split the truffled mushrooms (truffle gouda, holy crap right?) to start, and they were amazing. I opted for the half roasted (herby, juicy) chicken over mashed potatoes, and my husband went with the bone-in filet with a side of mac and cheese. His steak was cooked perfectly medium-rare. Before they were served, we got to select our own knives out of their little knife collection box. A fun touch.  The food was divine. Like I said, everything was cooked perfectly and the little crock of mac was deceiving--it was so rich and cheesy that we couldn't finish it off! Our server found out we were celebrating a birthday and presented us with a free order of their butter cake (GOOEY, molten cake with sauteed peaches, topped with candied pecans and a side of bacon-vanilla ice cream. OMG.) It was an amazing way to end the meal, but we honestly didn't NEED it. We were so, so stuffed. (But were we going to turn down free butter cake? NO WAY.)  There seemed to be a little too much time between ending our appetizer and receiving our main dishes, as well as getting our credit card picked up after we were done, but I know it takes a while for new places to get their bearings. Prices are pretty steep, but you're definitely paying for the location, the amazing food and the nice touches.  With my glass of wine, an appetizer, two mains and a side, we came out to $150 after tip. Definitely not a regular dining experience for us, but absolutely a place for celebrating and having a special night. It's Monday, and I'm still full!

eDXq8vusLVpT_NPoRsMJWA.text: Ugh. This place has such a great location and sexy vibe I hate to leave a somewhat negative review. We showed up to our reservation about 20 minutes early but they seated us right away which I really loved. Our server came by after ~8 minutes which I thought was a little long to be waiting. She was very friendly and provided great service throughout the meal so no other complaints there. I want to say her name was Ashley.   I ordered the East Coast Sour {Four Roses Bourbon | house sour | Cocchi Barolo Chinato | raspberry sorbet} and it was as delicious as it was beautiful! The key is to drink it from the side so you get the raspberry flavor in every sip. My friend got the Go Green {Hendricks Gin | cucumber | lemon juice | simple syrup | Fevertree bitter lemon soda} which was also excellent.   For appetizers we ordered 1/2 dozen west coast oysters served with daily house mignonette and cocktail sauce. I'm not sure exactly what type of oysters they were, but they were tiny and lacked flavor in my opinion. We also ordered the grilled squid and octopus, the octopus being dry but the seasoning was on point. For entrees we ordered twin lobster tails and the scallops. I didn't try the scallops but my friend said they were great. My lobster was chewy and didn't really have any flavor and didn't seem very fresh. The butter didn't even help! I also think they should offer to deshell it for you but maybe that's just me being snobby. I would definitely not order it again. We got a side of grilled mushrooms which were so overly seasoned and salty they were inedible. The mac & cheese on the other hand was the opposite-so bland with no flavor. The breadcrumbs on top were soft and not crunchy at all like it had been microwaved.   Like I said- the ambience and service in general were great, and the drinks were awesome. The food was just so forgettable and it ended up being a pricey 3 star meal.

ZqLIp6xNb7jVd_zq8DwFgw.text: My wife and I went after a long day of day drinking. When I got there I didn't even touch my jack and coke, but that's not why we went.  Everything is ala carte. So I ordered the New York, rare with sides of Mac-n-cheese and potatoes, double starch for obvious reasons. My wife had the filet which she said was perfect.  Our waiter, Brad, was a great guy who put up with us.  It is a little pricey but well worth it when you take out your bride away from the kids and th just enjoy a great dinner.

eZ3PTsTEMjxUWH7AcNBAWQ.text: This place was phenomenal! From the service to the food and location.  We had some great drinks! The Manhattan was very well crafted upto the brandies cherries!   The wine list was absolutely breathtaking. There were several California wines form our area and I was very pleased.   The dinner I had was the bone in filet, medium well. One word, breathtaking. It was perfectly made, the carrots were delicious and the potatoes just melted in your mouth.

photos.caption: Photo of Bourbon & Bones - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Imperial Manhattan .... AMAZING!

5o5pbM6nLvJ8yL4SBsoA5w.text: After wandering for awhile in the hot Arizona sun, we were happy to stumble upon this air conditioned wonderland just in time for HAPPY HOUR.    I cannot attest to the rest of the restaurant, but I gotta say, we were quite happy with our bar experience at happy hour.   I had a really nice wine that I liked, while Husband thought his Manhattan was one of his best ever.  (and he's had a few).  Complimentary bacon was brought to us with our drinks.  Yes, you heard right.  YUM.  Husband loved his happy hour burger and fries, while I went with the french onion soup off their regular menu and it was so good!  What a friendly fun place that we would love to go back to next time we're in town!

qs8D_iKtMgZfMJkpUQFAxw.text: A little disappointed. We had dinner at the bar.  There were 2 of us. 1) We ordered a bottle of wine. They served us 2 glasses of wine.  We commented immediately that we ordered a bottle.  He apologized and said he would be back with the bottle.  He came back and shared that it was his mistake, the two glasses were complimentary and gave us the bottle.  A few minutes late the Manager came by and picked up the 2 glasses that we had already had sips of and brought two new glasses...and they cracked the bottle.  All well and fine but definitely odd. 2) Tasting the bottle....they cracked the bottle and poured two tasters starting with the man and the myself.   3) After tasting, the bartender poured his glass of wine before mine (female).  Very strange. 4) Then screwed the cap BACK on the bottle instead of leaving the cap off and letting the bottle breathe. 5) Bartender was condescending and snippy.   All of this was incredibly surprising relative to what we anticipated for the meal and experience.  Appetizer: Octopus- Fair Meal: Bone in filet- excellent  Fernet Branca - very good  It will be more than a minute before we go back.  We'll stick with Mastros, less than a mile away, until they figure out how to run a high end steakhouse.

photos.caption: Photo of Bourbon & Bones - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

YkWUE7QqIRlyTcCOMZhvew.text: Overall, we had a great meal here. We came in around 5:30pm on a Saturday and the place was pretty empty. I guess it picks up more around 7-8, which makes sense, but definitely would come back much later if we returned. Noted.   Upon arrival, there is complementary valet which is super convenient. There is also a parking garage behind the building as well. The valet guy was super friendly.   When we walked in it was a bit awkward... a bunch of the wait staff was just kind of standing by the hostess stand staring. I get it wasn't busy yet and clearly we came a bit too early but it was a weird initial vibe. The hostess seemed in a horrible mood too, so as we sat down we had a bad taste in our mouth and were worried it was going to be a disastrous meal.   Luckily, our waitress came over and immediately turned it around! She was friendly, went over the menu, had great recommendations and checked in just enough. Not too much but she was still around. The guys assisting with refills and clearing plates were attentive and friendly as well.   They have an extensive bourbon list (duh!) as well as a good wine selection and other various cocktails. I just went with a glass of wine since I'm not a huge bourbon drinker. It was good.   They bring you a bread basket with some pretzel bread and traditional white bread. We also started with the grilled octopus, which I really enjoyed. It had good flavor but wasn't overwhelming and was the perfect starter.   After clearing our appetizer, they brought over a box of steak knives and let you select which kind of knife you want. I thought it was a fun concept and a cool touch.   We both ordered the filet, I ordered the 6oz with a side of chimichurri sauce, and my girlfriend ordered the 10oz. We decided to split a side of Mac n cheese as well.   Both of our steaks were cooked as requested and were delicious. I got the chimichurri sauce at the recommendation of our waitress and it was amazing.. it has a bit of a kick to it but it wasn't too spicy. It was awesome. My girlfriend enjoyed her steak plain as well.   The Mac n cheese was more than enough to split between the two of us. It was super creamy and had a milder cheese flavor. I was a big fan. They even scooped out the first serving into our plates for us when they delivered the meal. Nice touch.   After the meal, we did peruse the dessert menu and there were some interesting selections but we were just too full.   The overall building is nice, the bathrooms were sparking clean, and I liked the ambiance. Comfortable seating, part industrial, part pub, it was modern and trendy.   In the end, the food was delicious, it was a bit pricey but it's steak in old town Scottsdale so it's to be expected. I'd recommend if you are looking for a nicer meal and in the area.

KHGTUPexR4W9uvHe98Z1rQ.text: First visit review-- We were seated promptly with our reservation time. Nice atmosphere but it's a bit loud.  Service was excellent. Extensive list of wine, whiskey and mixed drinks.   Had oysters as an appetizer. Nice presentation and excellent horseradish.  Warm spinach salad was very tasty. Everyone in our party ordered steaks which were all good. I especially enjoyed my New York strip.  I very much enjoyed my evening here. I would definitely return.   Second visit-  this time the food was not so good. Three of the steaks that came out were barely room temperature.  Left extremely disappointed.  Obviously, this place does not have the consistency that I'm used to at steak 44 and Mastro's. Dropped my rating to a 3

d6K1c6jxLZOBNCd4vYIysw.text: So good!  We've been here a few times and the food, drinks, and service are always amazing. The steaks are great (we were bummed that they were out of prime rib...we will go earlier next time!) but overall everything was great. Our server (Brad) was awesome too!

SWQy5T0QVX0EJ31jCCiAlA.text: Disappointing,  the restaurant itself has amazing ambience. We are local foodies a d food bloggers that recently dined at Bourbon & Bones. We were thirsty with anticipation considering the vibe on Saturday night    Started with the crab cake and grilled octopus  The crabcake was flavorless, thankfully it came with sauce on the side. The octopus was boiled, not grilled as indicated on the menu.   Fast forward to the main course, could wait to have a 90 day dry aged rib eye. Huge disappointment in flavor, no way was the steak aged 90 days. Although tender and delicious,  was not the flavor of an aged steak.   All in all it was a great place to hang and you're not a food critic this place may satisfy your pallet

photos.caption: Photo of Bourbon & Bones - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

q8b1xjbNSDy9-22qRimbHQ.text: On a recent business trip to Scottsdale, my colleague and decided to get a steak dinner and randomly picked Bourbon & Bones, we were very much not disappointed and I highly recommend this spot. No, that's not the end of the review, if you want more detail, read on.  So Bourbon & Bones has the cuisine of a classic (see: grumpy old man) steakhouse, but with none of the classic items. The ambience is great, good music, style and decor. The staff is super friendly and attentive, offering amazing recommendations and making great conversation. Our server, Jeff, was never far and always ran over to help. He had some great whiskey recommendations. Which leads me to another great feature of B&B: the whiskey selection. It's massive, well organized and filled with tons of good stuff. It's easy to do an international whiskey tour in one evening and not totally break your wallet with alcohol.  As for the food, the steaks were cooked perfectly and the sides were great. I highly recommend the brussel sprouts (just a hint of sweetness) and the truffle lobster mac & cheese. We started the meal with a classic wedge salad, which did not disappoint. We also ended with the chocolate mousse desert, which was fantastic, flavorful, great texture and consistency and finished with some raspberries. It was the perfect way to end the meal.  Any negatives? Only that you're going to want to get a reservation ahead of time. Fortunately, we didn't have to wait too long, and it was totally work it. Next time you are in the area, definitely check it out!

Bv5ylwI9XNE7hgLBhyXi6Q.text: I think that this place is perfect for those who don't know good food, and certainly don't know good steak/chophouses. The atmosphere is pretty ok, hence two stars instead of one, but the food is atrocious. This is by far one of the worst steaks I've ever had, and the other items we've tried have been terrible on numerous occasions as well. The crab cakes are nothing more than fishy bread patties, the stuffed dates are so overwhelmingly greasy and rich, they're inedible. I suppose my side salad was ok, but it's relatively difficult to mess up lettuce with the dressing on the side. Note that the only protein you can really add to a salad here is shrimp... at $8 per piece of shrimp.   The wine selection is dismal at best, and that leads me to my next point - this restaurant is gratuitously pretentious for the sake of being pretentious. The menu boasts a $20k ZD pairing dinner for up to 12 people. Come again? ZD is far from a premier Napa vineyard compared to the likes of Caymus, Duckhorn, Cakebread et al, but I digress. Further - during wine season at Wright's, where the wine dinners are just as many courses and include the vineyards I just mentioned, each seat is only $125 per person. Anyhow, my point is that this place is great for people who don't actually understand what good food is, or what a restaurant experience at this price point should be, but hey. More powr to these folks. We will not, however, return...

ld3gFqwG3NBLN6-c_EZzfQ.text: Great place to go with a group of friends. We tried a lot last night, here were my favorites:  Noah's Mill bourbon Go Green (gin cocktail) Grilled octopus Blue cheese stuffed medjool dates The dry-aged tomahawk ribeye with bone marrow butter (adding the butter was such a good call) Sauteed wild mushrooms Brussel sprouts Key lime cheesecake Doughnut bread pudding  I ordered the imperial old fashioned with my steak but wasn't really a fan. I'm more of a classic old fashioned guy and this was too overpowering with the orange flavor. Next time I would probably just order a standard old fashioned with a lemon peel instead of orange and 1 sugar cube instead of a cherry.  I ordered the east coast sour with appetizers. Even though this is more fruity than I prefer with a cocktail, it was a really tasty drink and a good one to start the meal with.

NHe-QCsORAsO0LQEFpBH-A.text: This restaurant has a very pretty design and the ambiance is perfect. Has huge open windows and it is located in Old Town in Scottadale, Arizona. My fiance and I saw this restaurant and decided to just walk in and sit at the bar. The food was ok but it was the ambiance that made everything special. They greet you with bacon stripes. We then ordered wine, a caprese salad appetizer, oysters, and enjoyed it with their pretzel bread. We weren't very hungry we just wanted something light and this spot was perfect for that.

4bDwXlhDum78Z1-1forIag.text: I recently went here to celebrate my mother's birthday and I can easily say this place was such an exquisite delight to dine at. Our server was knowledgeable about the menu, dealt with our humor and excitement, and provided us excellent service by even bringing out a celebratory dessert. The food was incredible. My mom is a big fan of oyster Rockefeller so she specically asked the server if they could add Pernod in the dish since the restaurant doesn't usually prepare it that way. And guess what -- the chef did it and it certainly pleased the birthday girl! The restaurant was more than accommodating and truly impressed us. I can't recommend a specific thing because I guarantee the entire menu is equally as delicious as what I ordered. 5/5. Thanks for making my mom's birthday dinner so memorable!

ZRyG1pphm1TRdMZMjxLsEA.text: Good place although it's tough on vacation having authentic wagu beef the night before. Pros: Staff & Service is quite good Knife service is a nice touch Asparagus good and not over salted (not sure it needs the fried egg on top tho lol) Mushrooms were good and not over salted  Cons: The octopus appetizer was a valid attempt but would skip especially for the price  We had the tomahawk cut to share for two people to share. The only reason I've given three stars instead of four is because the Tomahawk was seasoned well, however was a bit too raw in the middle. I don't mind cooked on the outside and pink in the center, but for such a nice dry aged cut of meat cooked on the outside and right in the center is more reserved for sushi.

U8gUEMIhPsqvyjDCLj8tmw.text: Bourbon and Bones is the modern Mastro steakhouse just located in Oldtown Scottsdale with a more casual crowd and an extended variety of American bourbons.  I chose this place for my birthday dinner celebration on a Sunday night. The private room was not given to me however the table we had was nice.  Food was top notch! From the appetizers to entrees to desserts I did not find a complaint.  But the service is really why this place deserves full score: our waiter, Jeff, was phenomenal. He properly introduced himself, explained the menu and satisfied every request. Large parties are not easy to handle but I saw everyone was happy both with the food and the service.  If you order steak (I highly recommend it), they let you choose your steak knife. First time I saw this and I was impressed.  Wine selection is also fair. At the end of the dinner a free abundant dessert was given to me, and it's always a joy when a restaurant does that. Highly recommend. I will be back!
